No...[p/] Following your logic thus far,[p/] Sibyl was affected by [b]Stone Skin[/b] [i]and[/i] she was still conscious.
She would be immune to most blunt force impacts.
She must have been affected by a spell.
And considering it kept her from resisting Aria,[p/] the Patron must have made [i]Aria[/i] cast that spell on her.
No...[p/] Aria must've cast a spell on Sibyl.
And that spell would have prevented her from resisting Aria while she threw her off of the balcony.
Tyrion: It was [b]Hold Creature[/b]!
Tyrion: Sibyl must have cast [b]Stone Skin[/b] on herself when Aria attacked her.
Tyrion: The Patron must have known that Aria couldn't physically damage her like that.
Tyrion: So they ordered her to restrain Sibyl with that spell!
Lucio: ...!
Lucio: And Sibyl died by suffocation...
Tyrion: That's right, Lucio.
Tyrion: Even if she was restrained,[p/] Sibyl was still protected by [b]Stone Skin[/b].
Tyrion: That would've left only [i]one[/i] option for the Patron.
No...[p/] The Patron must have known that they couldn't physically harm Sibyl.
But they needed to murder her quickly before the Kingsguard realized what was going on.
Tyrion: Sibyl suffocated when Aria threw her into Lake Galakrond.
Tyrion: Her [b]Stone Skin[b/] lessened the impact of the fall.[p/] But it also made her drop like a literal rock.
Tyrion: Aria's [b]Hold Creature[/b] spell prevented her from moving or releasing her spell.
Tyrion: She was helpless as she sank to the bottom of the lake!
Rath: I believe that covers all three of the murders then.
Lucio: Yes...
Lucio: Lord von Sanctus suffocated to death in his own [b]Force Cage[/b].
Lucio: Lady Sibyl drowned after Aria cast [b]Hold Creature[/b] on her.
Lucio: And Lord Pierce died after being wounded by a blade created with [b]Shape Liquid[/b].
Rath: Hm...
Rath: The only common thread I see is that the Patron used some of the victims' magics against them.
...But how does that connect to Pierce?
Did he cast [b]Shape Liquid[/b] to make a blade to defend himself?
Maybe the murderer took it from him and used it against him.
...No.[p/] But he was knocked unconscious alongside you.
He [i]couldn't[/i] have been the one to create that blade.
Tyrion: ...Anyways,[p/] whoever did this had an in-depth knowledge of each of the spells they used to defend themselves.
Tyrion: They knew that Von Sanctus couldn't dispel his own [b]Force Cage[/b].
Tyrion: And they also knew that he still needed oxygen from within it.
Tyrion: And in Sibyl's case,[p/] they knew Aria couldn't physically harm her once she had [b]Stone Skin[/b] active.
Lucio: They also knew that [b]Hold Creature[/b] would prevent Sibyl from [i]dispelling[/i] her own [b]Stone Skin[/b].
Tyrion: Not only that.[p/] They did all of this in a quick time frame.
Tyrion: Von Sanctus and Sibyl died within thirteen minutes of each other.
Tyrion: And if Aria hadn't encountered Celeste,[p/] Pierce might've died [i]just[/i] as quickly.
Rath: So whoever did this had an in-depth knowledge of high-level magic.
Lucio: Not only that...[p/] They came up with creative ways to bypass the defenses put up by von Sanctus and Sibyl.
Rath: Yes...[p/] They had the ability to react quickly and decisively.
Lucio: *sigh*[p/] But considering the circumstances...[p/] that [i]hardly[/i] narrows it down.
Lucio: Several members of the Four Pillar Families were present that day.
Lucio: Each and every one of them studied at the Imperial Academy.
Lucio: They would all be knowledgeable in magic and its applications.
Something they're saying isn't sitting right by you for some reason.
There's [i]something[/i] there.[p/] So why can't you see it?
Ugh...[p/] It's no use.[p/] You just can't piece it together yet.
...But you're not finished yet.
Tyrion: There's another angle to this.
Tyrion: Consider [i]who[/i] the Patron did and [i]didn't[/i] target.
Tyrion: The victims were Lloyd von Sanctus,[p/] Coraline Sibyl,[p/] and Garrick Pierce.
Tyrion: What's a similarity that we can draw between at least two of them?
No...[p/] The victims were von Sanctus,[p/] Sibyl,[p/] and Pierce.
It doesn't quite work for all three of them.
But there is a common thread between at least two of them.
Tyrion: Von Sanctus and Sibyl were the heads of their respective noble houses.
Rath: Are you saying the Patron's goal was to assassinate leaders of the Four Pillars?
Tyrion: That's the motive that makes the most sense.
Tyrion: ...But that [i]does[/i] leave one question.
Lucio: ...
Lucio: Don't be coy.[p/] I'm not [i]daft[/i], Cuthbert.
Tyrion: Actually,[p/] I [i]highly[/i] doubt it was you.
Lucio: ...Really, now?
Tyrion: Out of most of the people there,[p/] you could have easily tricked your daughter into signing a Blood Contract.
Tyrion: But [i]why[/i] would you need to do that?
Tyrion: You're the Grand General of Wyverngarde's military,[p/] and the Cathedral was [i]filled[/i] with your men.
Tyrion: You could have easily equipped one of your best mages to carry out this massacre.
Tyrion: And you wouldn't even [i]need[/i] to make a deal with a demon to do so.
Rath: So why [i]wasn't[/i] Lucio targeted then?
Tyrion: From her encounter with Celeste,[p/] it's clear there's a limit to Aria's combat capabilities.
Tyrion: The Patron might've simply doubted Aria's ability to defeat the Grand General.
Tyrion: But there's also another explanation.
No...[p/] The Patron made no attempt to kill Lucio Steelwind.
And when they were controlling Aria,[p/] they didn't make any attempt to hide her actions.
They [i]wanted[/i] people to see her.
Tyrion: The Patron [i]wanted[/i] people to suspect House Steelwind for the murders.
Tyrion: They used Lucio Steelwind's daughter to commit the crime.
Tyrion: Then they intentionally left him alive to cast suspicion on him.
Lucio: ...[i]That's[/i] why they used my daughter?
...Is that a tinge of anger you feel from him?
Tyrion: ...Anyways,[p/] [i]that[/i] leads me to my next point.
Tyrion: Imagine if we never discovered Aria's Blood Contract with the Empress of Discord.
Tyrion: What would have happened?
Rath: ...We'd still think that Ms. Steelwind succumbed to Mageblight.
Rath: She would have been convicted for the murders,[p/] and trust in House Steelwind would be forever diminished.
Tyrion: About a month ago,[p/] House Frega lost its head.
Tyrion: And his successor:[p/] Laefe Frega,[p/] was woefully unprepared to take his place.
Tyrion: [i]Now[/i], the heads of House von Sanctus and House Sibyl are dead.
Tyrion: ...With House Steelwind being held responsible for it all.
Rath: All Four of the Pillar families would have been weakened as a result of the massacre...
Tyrion: But I think there's another layer to this.
Tyrion: Everything fits together if we assume that the Patron's goal was to weaken the Pillar Families.
Tyrion: ...[i]Except[/i] for the murder of Garrick Pierce.
Lucio: Yes...[p/] In contrast to Sibyl and von Sanctus,[p/] Pierce's political power pales in comparison.
Tyrion: Furthermore,[p/] Pierce was already scheduled to be executed next month for the murder of Flinhart McCoy.
Tyrion: Why would the Patron go to the trouble of murdering a condemned man?
No...[p/] Pierce was [i]going[/i] to die regardless of what the Patron did.
But there [i]has[/i] to be something Pierce did recently.
Something that made the Patron decide to murder him as soon as possible.
Tyrion: The Patron murdered Pierce because they [i]needed[/i] him to die as quickly as possible.
Tyrion: Pierce [i]knew[/i] the identity of Celeste's biological parents.
Celeste: ...My parents?
Tyrion: Do you remember what Pierce said when we showed up for the meeting?
Garrick: Ah...[p/] You've finally arrived...
Garrick: I suppose this means you've finally decided-
Garrick: Wait...[p/][s/] [i]You[/i] two?
Celeste: We got your letter.
Garrick: Letter?[p/][s/] What letter?!
Tyrion: You...[p/] sent us a letter, Pierce.
Tyrion: It said that you knew who Celeste's parents were.
Garrick: I [i]did[/i] send that letter,[p/] but not to [i]you[/i] two.
Tyrion: We weren't the intended recipients of that letter.
Celeste: ...That's right!
Tyrion: So [i]that[/i] leaves one last question.
No...[p/] You have a feeling that Pierce sent that letter to someone closely tied to this case.
There's only one person he could have sent it to.
Tyrion: There's only one person Pierce could have sent that letter to.
Tyrion: The person who orchestrated the massacre in the first place![p/][s/] The Patron!
Lucio: But that means-!
Tyrion: The Patron is someone who would be threatened by Celeste's parentage!
Rath: Order![p/][s/] Order in the court!

...But you still haven't found any answers.
Aria: ...
Aria: Have you considered becoming a prosecutor?
Aria: Your time as my stand-in made it clear that you have the ability to.
Tyrion: ...A prosecutor.
You would have never even considered that a year ago...
But you understand now...[p/] There [i]are[/i] criminals who need to be brought to justice.
And despite how difficult she is to face,[p/] Steelwind never engages in outright corruption like the other prosecutors of the Crown.
If you follow her example,[p/] you could fight injustice that way...
...But even if you did that,[p/] you'd just be following someone [i]else's[/i] footsteps.[p/] Just like before...
Tyrion: ...I'll think about it.
Aria: Please do.[p/] At this point,[p/] I could use all the help I can find.
Tyrion: Have your injuries been healing well?
Aria: Yes.[p/] Nightgrave's skill in [b]necromancy[/b] is quite remarkable.
Aria: I'm glad I introduced him to House Asclepius.
Tyrion: ...Asclepius?
Aria: House Asclepius specializes in the study of [b]necromancy[/b].
Aria: After Nightgrave's expulsion from the academy,[p/] I thought it was only right that he be allowed to continue his studies.
Celeste: Right.[p/] He mentioned that he owed you a favour.
Aria: It was only logical.[p/] It would be a waste to let someone of his talents fade into obscurity.
You're glad Wallace was able to continue his studies.
He clearly wants to use his talents to better society.
...He's definitely in a better place than you are right now.
Tyrion: Even so...[p/] Should you still be moving around like this?
Tyrion: You should take some time off to recover.
Aria: As much as I would like to,[p/] there's been a recent uptick in cases of Mageblight lately.
Mageblight...[p/] You recall hearing about that many times.
If a mage exceeds their stamina by overusing their magic,[p/] it starts to affect their mind and send them into a violent frenzy.
Aria: To make matters worse,[p/] the nobility has been trying to suppress information about these incidents.
Tyrion: Right...[p/] It's not a good look whenever a mage goes on a murderous rampage.
Aria: I was actually surprised to see you here, Celeste.
Celeste: Well...[p/] I can't just leave him alone anymore.[p/] He ticked off a criminal overlord.
Celeste: They're definitely going to send someone after him. [mind="...And he can't really take care of himself right now."/]
Tyrion: ...Celeste.[p/] Your thoughts are leaking.
Celeste: Hey...[p/] Get out of my head.
Aria: ...What?
Tyrion: ...It's nothing.
Aria: I [i]am[/i] surprised, though.[p/] Not many people slight the Eyetaker and live.
Aria: He's known for taking swift retaliation against his enemies.
Celeste: We're hoping he's laying low after his plan with Beatrice fell through.
Aria: That [i]does[/i] match with the reports I've read.
Aria: Supposedly,[p/] he's been absent from many of his enterprises.
Either way...[p/] You're not looking forward to dealing with him.
It's bad enough that you're already on the nobility's bad side.
Celeste: ...By the way, Tyrion.[p/] Ruby sent another letter.
Celeste: Do you want to-?
Tyrion: ...Put it with the rest.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...
Aria: ...Have you spoken to her since the trial?
Tyrion: ...
Aria: I see...[p/] That [i]does[/i] explain her recent mood.
Celeste: Right.[p/] You two probably see each other a lot.
Aria: I've prosecuted a few of her clients recently.
Aria: But it's clear she's not nearly as threatening as before.
Tyrion: ...Could we talk about something else?
Aria: Of course.[p/] My apologies.
Aria: Are you doing well, Mr. Cuthbert?[p/] You seem...
Tyrion: I'm fine.[p/] Why wouldn't I be?
Aria: ...Of course.
Celeste: ...
Aria: It's just that you haven't taken any other clients since Beatrice's trial.
Tyrion: I'm going to be honest.[p/] I'm not even sure if I [i]want[/i] to be a defense attorney anymore.
Celeste: What?
Tyrion: I've been following this path for so long...[p/] But I was only doing it because someone else told me to.
Aria: Did you not enjoy it?[p/] As much as I hate to admit it,[p/] you were very skilled at it.
Tyrion: I don't know anymore.[p/] That's why I've been taking some time to think about my life.
Tyrion: ...But I still haven't found any answers.
Aria: ...
Aria: Have you considered becoming a prosecutor?
Aria: Your time as my stand-in showed that you definitely have the ability to.
Tyrion: ...A prosecutor.

It's definitely intriguing.[p/] At the very least,[p/] you don't have any other options.
Tyrion: ...I'll think about it.
Aria: Please do.[p/] I could use all the help I can get.

Aria: Yes.[p/] Nightgrave's skill in [b]necromancy[/b] is quite remarkable.

Aria: Of course.[p/] My apologies.
Aria: ...Why are you showing this to me?
Tyrion: S-[p/]Sorry.[p/] Force of habit.
Celeste: Oh![p/] The tea's ready.
Aria: Oh,[p/] thank you.[p/] Some tea sounds lovely right now.
Celeste: R-[p/]Right...[p/] I was [i]totally[/i] making it for you guys.
She walks to the cabinet in your kitchen.[p/] And she takes out two more tea cups.
Celeste: You guys better enjoy this.[p/] These are my last bags of-
Celeste: W-[p/][s/]Woah!
As she walks over to you,[p/] she slips on a scroll case that you left on the floor.
She regains her balance,[p/] but the teacups slip out of her hands.[p/] The boiling liquid is airborne and is heading right toward your face.
Celeste: [b]Figaqua[/b]!
Celeste reacts immediately and points her index finger at the tea.
Her magic takes hold,[p/] and the tea freezes just inches from your face.
She breathes a sigh of relief,[p/] and she brings the tea back into their cups.
Celeste: You really need to clean this place.
Celeste: I'm your bodyguard,[p/] not your maid.
Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right.[p/] Sorry about that...
Aria: That was [b]Shape Liquid[/b], wasn't it?
Celeste: Yeah...
Tyrion: Oh...[p/] I never expected you to-
Celeste: I know...[p/] But it's just too convenient [i]not[/i] to have.
She's really opened her mind about learning new spells.
You remember when you first met her.
Back then,[p/] she only knew how to cast [b]Mage Blade[/b].
She hated magic back then...[p/] You never imagined how diverse her repertoire would become.
Celeste: ...[i]Another[/i] visitor?
Tyrion: I'm already up.[p/] I'll check it.
Celeste: Well [i]whoever[/i] they are,[p/] I'm not giving up any more of my Lotus Tea.
You open the door and don't see anyone.[p/] But there's a letter in your mailbox.
You take a closer look at the envelope.[p/] It's sealed with candle wax.
There's a crest on it...[p/][s/] It's the insignia of House Pierce!
You quickly open the letter and read it.
Despite supposedly being written by a noble,[p/] the paper has been torn in half.[p/] But the message is clear.
Garrick: [i]I hope you understand...[p/] I would've never contacted you unless I had no other choice.[/i]
Garrick: [i]I know the truth behind McCoy's [i]true[/i] parentage.[p/] And I'm aware of how vital this information is to you.[/i]
Garrick: [i]As you know,[p/] my execution is scheduled for next month.[p/] And I'm running out of time.[/i]
Garrick: [i]I want to trade this information with you.[p/] In exchange,[p/] you [b]will[/b] grant me my freedom.[/i]
Garrick: [i]Meet me in the private Prayer Room within the Grand Cathedral of the Scaled Lord at 2:00 PM...[/i]
Garrick: [i]You [b]will[/b] save me from my fate,[p/] or else[/i]
Tyrion: ...What?!
Celeste: If he thinks for a second that we'd even [i]think[/i] of helping him-!
Tyrion: I know how you feel.[p/] But aren't these the answers you've been looking for?
Celeste: I don't care![p/][s/] We're [i]not[/i] going to help him!
Tyrion: That was never an option.[p/] But there's clearly more to this.
Aria: ...I agree.[p/] How was he able to find out in the first place?
Aria: The truth is, Celeste...[p/] I've also been looking into your parentage.
Celeste: What?!
Celeste: Why didn't you say anything?!
Aria: I'm sorry.[p/] But I didn't want to raise your hopes.
Aria: And I was apparently right to do so.[p/] I couldn't find [i]any[/i] information regarding your birth.
Celeste: ...
Tyrion: So if [i]you[/i] couldn't find anything,[p/] how was [i]Pierce[/i] able to?
Aria: House Pierce is low on the political hierarchy.[p/] He doesn't have access to the resources I do.
Aria: He [i]does[/i] own the land the McCoy Tavern is on.
Aria: But frankly,[p/] this whole situation is quite suspect.
Tyrion: And why would he ask for [i]my[/i] help?[p/] [i]I[/i] was the one who indicted him in the first place.
Tyrion: Even if I [i]did[/i] agree to help him,[p/] it would be nearly impossible for me to get him an acquittal.
Aria: He must be desperate.
Aria: His execution is scheduled for next month, after all.
Aria: It's possible that he reached out to Tymora as well.
Aria: Still...[p/] I can't believe he'd set up a meeting at the Grand Cathedral, [i]today[/i] of all days.
Tyrion: ...Why?[p/] What's happening there?
Aria: I'm sorry...[p/] But it's not my place to tell you.
Celeste: ...
Celeste: Aria,[p/] can I talk with Tyrion alone for a minute?
Aria: Of course.[p/] I'm sure you have much to discuss.
Aria: I actually also have business at the Cathedral today. [mind="I can't believe he'd use that as an opportunity."/]
Aria: I'll be taking my leave.
Tyrion: I'm sorry...[p/] I'm sure this is just bringing up bad memories for you.
Celeste: ...We should meet with him.
Tyrion: ...What?
Celeste: We're not going to help him, obviously.[p/] But I had an idea.
Celeste: He's probably really scared of his execution, right?[p/] And he's desperate enough to ask [i]you[/i] for help.
Tyrion: I suppose that's true...
Celeste: So...[p/] Think about how stressed he would be if you showed up and refused to help him.
Tyrion: ...!
Tyrion: I could use the Eye of Horus on him.
Celeste: We can get the info we need without having to give him [i]anything[/i].
Tyrion: ...But are you really okay with this?[p/] You'll have to see him again.
Celeste: Yeah...[p/] I'll manage.
Celeste: And it'll be worth it if we can finally get the answers I'm looking for.
You've already gotten her hopes up,[p/] but there's no guarantee that he actually knows the truth.
He could just be bluffing to get you to help him.
...But if he [i]does[/i] know.[p/] You can't just ignore this.
You need to verify his claims yourself.
Celeste: So [i]this[/i] is the Grand Cathedral of the Scaled Lord.
Tyrion: Have you never been here before?
Tyrion: I thought you spent a lot of time in Ratholme.
Celeste: The Church of Bahamut wasn't that popular in my hometown.[p/] And I've never been the religious type.
Celeste: What about you?
Tyrion: It never really caught on with me.
Tyrion: ...And apparently my roots are more celestial than draconic.
Celeste: Yeah.[p/] I guess that makes sense. [mind="He certainly has the looks for it..."/]
Tyrion: ...Your thoughts are leaking again.
Celeste: Can you stop?
Tyrion: I can't exactly turn it off, you know.
Tyrion: Do those mental exercises I taught you.
Celeste: Ugh...
As you approach the Grand Cathedral,[p/] you see a large blockade guarded by legions of the Kingsguard.
Celeste: It's closed off...[p/] Is there some kind of event going on?
You recall Steelwind mentioning that she was heading here as well.
The nobility must be using the cathedral grounds for something.
It might explain why Pierce wanted to meet you here.[p/] It's probably secluded from prying eyes today.
Knight: ...Tyrion Cuthbert?
As you approach the blockade,[p/] one of the knights notices you.
He glances at you and Celeste.
Knight: ...We've been expecting you.
Tyrion: I...[p/] see.
You exchange glances with Celeste.[p/] But you both enter the cathedral grounds.
The main building is massive...[p/] yet mostly empty.
You only see a few people within,[p/] and most of them are quite familiar.
You spot Laefe and Miriam as you head further into the room.
They both avoid eye contact with you.[p/] But it doesn't seem to be [i]purely[/i] out of resentment.
As soon as they see you,[p/] they move their conversation elsewhere.
It's clear they still have mixed feelings about how you convicted their sister.
In another corner of the room,[p/] you spot Lloyd von Sanctus speaking with another individual.
She seems to be someone of equal social standing.
You feel like you've seen her somewhere before.[p/] But you can't quite remember where.
As soon as you enter the room,[p/] von Sanctus flashes a quick look of disdain at you.
You see him slowly move his conversation out of the room as well.
And finally,[p/] you see Lucio Steelwind speaking with his daughter.
...along with the two princes.
They seem to speaking with another individual that you haven't met before.
When he notices you,[p/] his gaze narrows.[p/] And he stares at the two of you warily.
Aster, especially, seems surprised to see you here.
He and Lucio ask the prosecutor something.[p/] But you can't quite hear their conversation.
When she responds,[p/] Aster raises his eyebrows and Lucio's expression darkens.
What's going on here?
Celeste: This is a little awkward.
Tyrion: Yeah...
Tyrion: But we have some time before our meeting with Pierce.
Tyrion: ...You want to do some sightseeing?
Celeste: Oh?[p/] Are you asking me out?
Tyrion: We are [i]literally[/i] already out.
Celeste: Sure.[p/] Why not?
Celeste: I picked up this map from the entrance.[p/] We can use it to navigate through the area.
Celeste: I'm also a little interested in what all these nobles are doing here.
